SEARCH
Module comp3111.examsystem
Package comp3111.examsystem.entity.Questions

Class QuestionTypeFactory

java.lang.Object
comp3111.examsystem.entity.Questions.QuestionTypeFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultipleQuestionType, ShortQuestionType, SingleQuestionType, TrueFalseQuestionType
public abstract sealed class QuestionTypeFactory extends Object permits ShortQuestionType, SingleQuestionType, MultipleQuestionType, TrueFalseQuestionType
Sealed abstract class containing validation and UI set-up related methods for different question type. Should be inherited only by 4 different question types
Author:
Cheung Tuen King

  • Constructor Details

    • QuestionTypeFactory

      public QuestionTypeFactory()

  • Method Details

    • validateAnswer

      public abstract String validateAnswer(String answer) throws Exception
      Validate the answer text, varying on different question type. Visit this method of specific type for details
      Parameters:
      answer - Answer for validation
      Returns:
      Validated and finalized answer for storing
      Throws:
      Exception - Any validation rule is not met for the specific type

    • initialize

      public void initialize(javafx.scene.control.TextField[] options, Question question) throws Exception
      Fill in the question form option UI based on the question given. Different question type could have different UI initialization. This concrete method particularly for single and multiple type
      Parameters:
      options - TextField for question form option
      question - Question entity for initialization
      Throws:
      Exception - Question option does not meet the validation rules. Visit QuestionTypeFactory.validateOption() for details

    • validateOption

      public void validateOption(String option, int index) throws Exception
      Validate option, which have text length in range (0, QuestionDatabase.OPTION_LENGTH_LIMIT)
      Parameters:
      option - Option text
      index - Integer 0 to 3 indicating option A to D
      Throws:
      Exception - Option text length out of range

    • saveOptions

      public void saveOptions(javafx.scene.control.TextField[] fields, String[] options)
      Save the option text user inputted in question form UI before user changing the question type. The saved questions are used to restore the option text when the type change to single or multiple type.
      Parameters:
      fields - Array of TextField displaying option text
      options - Array for storing options

    • setUpForm

      public void setUpForm(javafx.scene.control.Label[] labels, javafx.scene.control.TextField[] fields, String[] options, javafx.scene.control.Label originalLabel, javafx.scene.control.TextField originalField)
      Set up the question form UI by setting, disabling or enabling the labels and text field guiding and inputting options. Current implementation is for multiple and single question type, where all Labels showing "Option A" to "Option D" and option TextField enabled
      Parameters:
      labels - Array of Label guiding options input
      fields - Array of TextField for inputting options
      options - Array for storing options
      originalLabel - Original Label as reference for resetting the modified Labels
      originalField - Original TextField as reference for resetting the modified TextFields

    • getInstance

      public static QuestionTypeFactory getInstance(QuestionType type)
      Access the specific subclasses of QuestionTypeFactory based on the question type provided
      Parameters:
      type - Question type
      Returns:
      QuestionTypeFactory subclasses related to the type given
